text: My name's Nick.
I'm with Owens Corning.

I've been in the IT
industry for about 25 years.

I've been in networking,
in security, in operations,
servers, people management,
and all of those kind of culminated into
what we now call DevOps.
But when I joined Owens Corning,
I had all the skillset to do the job.

But Owens Corning has a
philosophy of education

and the growth that
they're pushing us for.

It's a challenge of the
status quo to to grow,
to experiment, to evolve.

AWS Skill Builder allowed me
to focus on the content instead

of trying to drill through
opinions and suggestions.
When I knew what I was looking for
and I was able to find it easily
and easy to consume content.

The AWS Builder Lab really
helped me to actually dive in

and see how it works and use
it in real world examples was
great for my learning experience.

I actually jumped
directly into professional
certifications and the specialties.

AWS exam prep really helped
me to feel comfortable in

what I was doing and know that
when I actually sat the exam,
I was able to answer all
these questions in a knowledgeable way.

My knowledge and certifications
allowed me to showcase
that I'm a subject matter expert.
We can then have other teams lean on us
and come to us for knowledge
and allows us to really expand
that conversation out at Owens Corning.
